name: Check dependencies before completing Awork tasks (Workaround)
description:
Awork currently does not support a check for open subtasks or open dependencies when setting a task status to done. This workflow offers you a simple workaround to add this functionality to Awork and notifies users when triggered. Multiple configuration options available.

**How it works**
* Triggered via Awork Webhook call on status change of tasks
* If task is marked as done, subtasks and/or dependent tasks are checked for their status
* If unfinished tasks are found, a status rollback to previous status is performed and user gets notified 

**Set up steps**
* Add webhook call to Awork
* Configure Awork API credentials
* Set up workflow configuration via setup node, e.g. user notification text, restrict to subtasks/dependency checks etc.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

assignments.name: commentTextDependencies
assignments.value: Some dependencies not yet finished! Status rolled back!

assignments.name: commentTextTreeStructure
assignments.value: Some child tasks not yet finished! Status rolled back!

parameters.content:
## Awork workaround for done tasks with subtasks or dependencies


Currently, [Awork](https://www.awork.com/) does **not** offer direct support for the following functions:

* If a task has subtasks, then it should not be able to be marked as completed while subtasks are still open
* If a task is dependent on other tasks, then it should not be able to be marked as completed as long as these linked tasks are still open

### This n8n workflow offers the following functions:

* Checking whether all subtasks of a task have been completed before it can be completed 
* Check whether tasks marked as prerequisites have been completed before the task can be marked as completed
* If the condition for completing a task is not fulfilled, the workflow rolls back the status to the previous status
* A comment is added to the task as to why this roll back occurred
* This workflow **does not use** the Awork community nodes package, as this package does not support all API calls and is therefore not used by me. If you would like to use that package, you can find more information at [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/9826591-n8n-integration](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/9826591-n8n-integration) and replace the http nodes with matching community nodes if applicable


### The following configuration settings are possible or required in the ‚ÄúWorkflow config‚Äù node (following the webhook call):

* **finishedStateLabels** (required): Label text of the task status entities that have the ‚ÄúDone‚Äù state. Must be stored as an array. Allows you to control whether the workflow is skipped for certain status changes, even if the task has been marked as completed.

* **useDependencies** (optional): Boolean setting as to whether dependencies should be taken into account or not. If true, a task can only be marked as completed if the linked tasks have been marked as completed.

* **useTreeStructure** (optional): Boolean setting whether parent and child tasks are taken into account. If true, then parent tasks can only be marked as completed if all child tasks have been marked as completed.

* **addComments** (optional): Boolean setting as to whether a comment is added to a task if a status change has been undone by the workflow

* **commentTextDependencies** (optional, required if addComments is true): Comment text that is added to a task when the status change is undone for uncompleted tasks on which the current task is dependent. Serves as a hint for the user.

* **commentTextTreeStructure** (optional, required if addComments is true): Comment text that is added to a task when the status change is undone for uncompleted subtasks. Serves as a hint for the user.

## How to use

**Awork configuration**

* Copy this workflow to your n8n installation
* Add authentication credentials

* Add a new webhook call to Awork (see [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415462-webhooks](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415462-webhooks)) and configure as required (name, authentication etc.)
* Configure the webhook to be called on task status changes
* Enable "Only events from first level properties" to reduce the number of webhook calls
* Test and save webhook

* Generate a new API client (or use existing) (see [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415664-client-applications-and-api-keys](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415664-client-applications-and-api-keys))

* Add new credentials for Awork to your n8n installation (see [https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/add-edit-credentials/](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/add-edit-credentials/))
++ Choose "Header auth" from the list and name as you like, e.g. "Awork API Access"
++ Set "name" to "Authorization" and "value" to "Bearer XXX" with XXX being replaced by the API key created in Awork


## Enjoy
### Extract status changes from webhook call payload

### Check if task status is currently "done"
* If yes, proceed
* If no, exit workflow

### Check if dependencies are enabled
* If yes, process dependencies
* If no, check if tree structure is enabled
### Load task dependencies and filter open tasks

### Check if tasks marked as dependencies are open
* If yes, roll back status.
* If not, proceed to tree structure check

### Check if comment should be added to task
* Exit workflow if no comment should be added

### Add comment to task regarding roll back of task state
* Add comment and exit workflow

### Check if tree structure check is enabled
* Exit workflow if not enabled

### Check if task has subtasks
* Exit workflow if no subtasks found

nodes.name: Roll back task status from done to previous state

parameters.name: filterby
parameters.value: =parentid eq guid'{{ $('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.id }}' and taskstatus/type ne 'done'

parameters.content: ### Load subtasks not marked as done

### Check if open subtasks exist
* Exit workflow if no open subtasks found

### Check if comment should be added to task
* Exit workflow if no comment should be added

### Add comment to task regarding roll back of task state
* Add comment and exit workflow
